meanings.definition: Consign or dismiss to an inferior rank or position.
meanings.sent1: The coach relegates players to the bench if they do not perform well.
meanings.sent2: The manager relegates the new employee to filing paperwork until they gain more experience.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly relegates the class clown to the role of 'chief pencil sharpener'.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawn is often relegated to a less important role compared to the queen.
meanings.sent5: The strict supervisor relegates any mistakes to the 'do better next time' category.

meanings.definition: Transfer to a less important position or rank.
meanings.sent1: During the reorganization, the company relegates some employees to different departments.
meanings.sent2: The professor relegates the student's paper to the bottom of the grading pile due to its poor quality.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully relegates the unpopular dish to the 'specials' menu to see if it gains more attention.
meanings.sent4: The fading star feels like the industry is relegating them to a forgotten corner.
meanings.sent5: The old book was relegated to the dusty shelf in the back of the library.

meanings.definition: Assign an inferior rank or position to.
meanings.sent1: The judge relegates the defendant to a lower status due to their actions.
meanings.sent2: The captain relegates the troublemaker sailor to swabbing the deck as punishment.
meanings.sent3: The artist whimsically relegates the color green to the background of the painting.
meanings.sent4: The fading light of the day relegates the once vibrant colors to shadows.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher relegates any disruptions to the 'time out' corner.
